definition: Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
inscription/autograph
in one's own handwriting
Wang Guowei (1877-1927), noted scholar
to inscribe a poem (often, composed on the spot) on a painting, fan or ceramic bowl etc as a work of calligraphy/an inscribed poem
Chen Yun (1905-1995), communist leader and economist
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972

worthy predecessor/distinguished person of the past/former sage
to write or draw with a brush/to put pen to paper/to write
